items.title: Audubon Park, From Hinterlands to Urban Density
items.abstract: The ornithologist-painter John James Audubon took flight from Lower Manhattan to escape its ‘pestilential vapors.’ He landed in the picturesque woodland of the future Washington Heights, changing its landscape forever.

items.title: Just Because You Can Afford to Leave the City Doesn’t Mean You Should
items.abstract: It’s a mistake to blame density for the spread of the coronavirus.

items.title: Density Is New York City’s Big ‘Enemy’ in the Coronavirus Fight
items.abstract: New York is more crowded than any large city in the country. That helps explain why it is the U.S. epicenter of the outbreak.

items.title: Everything You Think You Know About Housing Is Probably Wrong
items.abstract: In cities, many people think “density” means crowded neighborhoods and greedy developers, but a new show at the Skyscraper Museum tells a different story.

items.title: On View | Frank Lloyd Wright’s Love-Hate Relationship With the American City
items.abstract: A new exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art captures the architect’s ambivalence toward urbanism by contrasting his unrealized plans for a suburban utopia with several proposals for massive skyscrapers.
